name: Emeraldene Inn & Eco-Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Emeraldene for a week at the start of October, principally to see the Humpback Whales. This is a great place to stay outside the bustle of the main town, but so convenient for trips out and about. The weather was not setlled when we visited with floods in Brisbane and high winds, but that was only 2 days. The Lodge is very comfortable and well equipped. Rob and his Father Alan were so helpful and friendly, knowing just what a Brit would like to see and do. Both the gardens and the wildlife in it were lovely. The highlights of the visit must be the Humpback whale trip - don't miss it. Rob can do all the booking for you. We went on Spirit of Hervey Bay, a catamaran, great crew, very informative and top notch. You mustn't forget to catch the fruit bats flight out at sunset too. Maryborough, Bundaberg all worth a visit. No worries, ask Rob he knowns all the best places to go. Hervey Bay itself is delightful with excellent shopping, walks by the sea and safe swimming. A very memorable trip..
reviews.title: Great, Friendly base for Whales and more

reviews.text: Three families travelling together for a total of 11. A real bunch, with kids...
reviews.title: We spent just two nights, unfortunately

reviews.text: Emeraldene Inn is in a quiet spot with all facilities. Spacious apartments, tidy and clean.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.text: Tours to Fraser Island booked thru hotel, no waste of time.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Great Staff, Everything you could need!!

reviews.text: Thanks Rob for hosting us.
reviews.title: Good Budget Motel

reviews.text: The Emeraldene was a nice departure from the city. Of couse, we spent so much time on our adventure tours that we didn't have as much time to enjoy the room. The rooms were clean and cozy and the location was quiet.
reviews.title: Great Rooms! Great Tour Bookings!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think it would be great for families traveling in the area as well as anyone with a car. The area of Hervey Bay is pretty spread out, but the Inn is very helpful in providing advice on what to do an how to get around. I recommend getting fish and chips at Mr. Seafood, just down the road.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: This really is a hidden gem in the Hervey Bay area. Although you would need a car to get to the beach etc it was so nice to come back to this beautiful, quiet resort. The rooms were very spacious and surrounded by beautiful trees and birds. Rob was so helpful and was able to book a great trip to Fraser Island and recommend some excellent restaurants. Daily room service was an added bonus.
reviews.title: Great value and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a very comfortable night at the Emeraldene Inn before a 3 day camping tour of Fraser Island. The room has everything you need with kitchen facilities, and the rainforest grounds are peaceful and quiet. Rob was very friendly and helpful and kindly allowed us to leave the car parked in the grounds while we were away.
reviews.title: Great staff and setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: exellent place to stay

reviews.text: Like other reviewers, we booked this on the basis of previous reviews and were not disappointed. Rob is a one-man wonder with great charisma and offered us loads of advice, including booking us onto the not-to-be-missed visit to the Mon Repos Turtle Rookery.
reviews.title: A friendly base from which to explore Hervey Bay

reviews.text: The room was simply furnished but spotlessly clean and serviced daily to a very high standard. Although the lodge is based slightly away from the main strip, if you have transport you can drive to restaurants in minutes. Our young daughter loved the swimming pool and for the price this place is hard to beat.
reviews.title: two cannuck in hervey bay

reviews.text: We decided to visit fraser island and didn't really know where to stay,so we look up trip advisor to see what was available..
reviews.title: Very Very Good! - Amazing service PreArrival and during stay

reviews.text: We saw that the emeraldene had good reviews and decided to take our chance there,on arrival bob and his dad where there to great us,they were really friendly and had a very cozy attitude with us,made us fell good about this place right away.
reviews.title: Wonderful.

reviews.text: We had no idea how to procced with the booking of the differents tours that are available on fraser islands,bob took his time and proceded with all the explanations that was needed for us to make a good decision,we finally decided on one tour of two days and he made all the reservation for us,awsome.
reviews.title: well deserved reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my girlfriend for just 2 nights as we used Hervey Bay as the gateway for our trip to Fraser Island. We had hired a car from Brisbane airport and drove up to Hervey Bay which took about 3 hours.
reviews.title: Great Value for Money, Extremely Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst driving up to Hervey Bay we contacted the Eco Lodge and spoke with the manager Rob who was extremely helpful and booked our trip to Fraser island for us (which we had left until the last minute!). We were also not arriving until quite late at night (after the reception shut) and Rob ensured he told us everything we needed to know and left our room unlocked for us to ensure our arrival was hassle free.
reviews.title: Awesome Value - Great Packages

reviews.text: The Eco Lodge is set in lovely rural, peaceful surroundings, a few kilometres from the coast so I guess without a car, it may be a bit inconvenient to stay here.
reviews.title: awesome stay at Emeraldene inn, Hervey Bay

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable and had enough facilities for basic self catering (fridge, kettle, microwave, sink). The Eco Lodge also offered bbq food packs (to be cooked on their "residents" bbq) and other items which could be pre ordered.
reviews.title: A Great Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Compared to other hotels in the area the Eco Lodge was much cheaper, and offers great value for money
reviews.title: Excellent location, massive rooms, very helpful and kind manager

description: The Emeraldene Inn & Eco-Lodge is a peaceful and relaxing eco-resort offering modern and impeccably presented accommodations. It is located in the peaceful Pialba region of Hervey Bay, and features 14 rooms set amongst two magnificent acres of natural bushland and landscaped gardens. This family owned and operated boutique resort provides true Australian hospitality with a commitment to ensuring friendly, personalized service and reliable local advice.
